revised_title: The Functional Role and Structure of Sea Urchin Madreporite Pore Canals
tldr: The study investigates the structure and function of the pore canals in sea urchin madreporite, revealing that they play a crucial role in pressure equalization between the water-vascular system and the external environment. The researchers also discovered that water flows inwards through the pore canals while particles suspended in water move in the opposite direction. This finding provides insights into the madreporite's function and its role in sea urchin biology.
